name: Levi Strauss
title: Nike: Early Turnaround Progress but Premium Valuation Keeps Risk/Reward Balanced at Hold
description:
Stifel Nicolaus analyst Peter McGoldrick has maintained their neutral stance on NKE stock, giving a Hold rating on December 26.
At the same time, McGoldrick believes the equity market is already assigning Nike a premium valuation multiple that assumes successful execution of the turnaround over the next several years.
While he characterizes the eventual turnaround as likely, he does not yet see a sufficiently asymmetric risk/reward profile to justify a more constructive recommendation.
As a result, he maintains a neutral stance and continues to rate the stock as Hold.
In another report released on December 26, UBS also maintained a Hold rating on the stock with a $62.00 price target.
text:
Stifel Nicolaus analyst Peter McGoldrick has maintained their neutral stance on NKE stock, giving a Hold rating on December 26.

Claim 70% Off TipRanks This Holiday Season

Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Peter McGoldrick has given his Hold rating due to a combination of factors related to Nike’s ongoing turnaround and its current valuation. He sees encouraging operational progress, including healthier inventory levels in North America that support the thesis of a domestically led recovery, and early signs that the apparel category is regaining volume momentum. He also notes that the company’s renewed emphasis on wholesale distribution, with the highest North America wholesale mix since the pandemic, appears more aligned with Nike’s future channel strategy, even though it entails lower average selling prices. However, footwear unit trends remain lackluster, and the overall volume trajectory is not yet strong enough to confidently underpin the mid-single-digit revenue growth needed to drive the financial model.

At the same time, McGoldrick believes the equity market is already assigning Nike a premium valuation multiple that assumes successful execution of the turnaround over the next several years. With the shares trading at roughly 25 times his FY27 earnings estimate, he views the upside potential as limited relative to the risks associated with restoring market share and normalizing the business, which he expects may not fully materialize until around 2027. While he characterizes the eventual turnaround as likely, he does not yet see a sufficiently asymmetric risk/reward profile to justify a more constructive recommendation. As a result, he maintains a neutral stance and continues to rate the stock as Hold.

McGoldrick covers the Consumer Cyclical sector, focusing on stocks such as Nike, Columbia Sportswear, and Levi Strauss & Co. According to TipRanks, McGoldrick has an average return of -1.3% and a 41.94% success rate on recommended stocks.

In another report released on December 26, UBS also maintained a Hold rating on the stock with a $62.00 price target.

name: Carrier
title: Supernet Limited rebrands as Supernet Global to expand international ICT footprint
description:
Supernet Limited has announced a strategic rebranding initiative under the name “Supernet Global” as part of its long-term plan to expand into international digital and ICT markets, according to a disclosure made to the Pakistan Stock Exchange on Wednesday.
The international service portfolio will include cybersecurity, cloud and data solutions, managed ICT services, Internet of Things platforms, enterprise connectivity through local partnerships and satellite-based connectivity solutions.
Founded in 1995, Supernet has nearly three decades of experience in delivering mission-critical ICT services, satellite connectivity and managed services to sectors including banking, energy, telecommunications, government and large enterprises.
Under the Supernet Global identity, the company aims to leverage this experience to expand internationally while contributing to Pakistan’s IT and services exports and generating foreign exchange through cross-border service delivery.
Supernet clarified that the rebranding does not affect its existing operations in Pakistan, with all domestic customer relationships and commitments remaining unchanged.
text:
Supernet Limited has announced a strategic rebranding initiative under the name “Supernet Global” as part of its long-term plan to expand into international digital and ICT markets, according to a disclosure made to the Pakistan Stock Exchange on Wednesday.

The company said the rebranding reflects its intention to selectively target high-growth regions, including the Middle East, Africa and Central Asia, while exporting Pakistan-origin digital, ICT and managed service expertise to global customers.

Supernet stated that the move aligns with sustained growth in ICT spending across emerging markets, driven by government-led digitalisation programmes, rising cybersecurity investments, increased cloud adoption and enterprise modernisation. The company also highlighted continued medium- to long-term growth prospects in the global satellite communications sector, one of its core business areas.

As part of the new strategy, Dubai has been designated as Supernet Global’s first regional hub, utilising its UAE-based subsidiary, Phoenix Global FZE, which has been operational since 2018.

The company said it will serve enterprise, carrier and institutional clients across multiple regions, while technical delivery, engineering and managed services functions will continue to be based in Pakistan.

The international service portfolio will include cybersecurity, cloud and data solutions, managed ICT services, Internet of Things platforms, enterprise connectivity through local partnerships and satellite-based connectivity solutions. Satellite services will remain a central component of the company’s international expansion model.

Founded in 1995, Supernet has nearly three decades of experience in delivering mission-critical ICT services, satellite connectivity and managed services to sectors including banking, energy, telecommunications, government and large enterprises. Under the Supernet Global identity, the company aims to leverage this experience to expand internationally while contributing to Pakistan’s IT and services exports and generating foreign exchange through cross-border service delivery.

Supernet clarified that the rebranding does not affect its existing operations in Pakistan, with all domestic customer relationships and commitments remaining unchanged.

name: Adobe
title: Adobe Photoshop 2025 AI Updates Boost Creativity and Efficiency - WebProNews
description:
Industry insiders note that this reduces the learning curve for complex edits, making Photoshop more accessible to multidisciplinary teams.
CNET reports that this addresses common frustrations in AI editing, such as iterative refinements, by enabling real-time feedback loops.
The Photoshop Training Channel outlines how these enhancements reduce lag in large-scale projects, a boon for film and game industry professionals handling high-resolution assets.
Ethical Considerations and Future Trajectories As AI permeates Photoshop, ethical questions arise, particularly around authenticity and bias in generated content.
Google’s AI updates blog, in a post on Google’s blog, parallels this by discussing breakthroughs in responsible AI, offering a comparative view for Photoshop users.
text:
Photoshop’s AI Renaissance: How Intelligent Tools Are Redefining Digital Editing in 2025

In the ever-evolving realm of digital creativity, Adobe Photoshop has long stood as the cornerstone for professionals in graphic design, photography, and visual arts. As we close out 2025, the software’s integration of artificial intelligence has reached new heights, offering tools that not only streamline workflows but also push the boundaries of what’s possible in image manipulation. Drawing from recent updates, these AI enhancements are transforming how insiders approach projects, from rapid prototyping to intricate compositing. This deep dive explores the most impactful features, their practical applications, and the implications for industry practitioners.

At the heart of Photoshop’s latest advancements is the Generative Fill tool, which has evolved significantly since its introduction. Powered by Adobe’s Firefly AI model, it allows users to add, remove, or expand elements within images using simple text prompts. For instance, professionals can now seamlessly extend backgrounds or insert objects that blend naturally with existing compositions. According to a detailed guide from Elegant Themes, this feature has become indispensable for photographers needing to adjust compositions without reshooting.

Beyond Generative Fill, the introduction of Harmonize and Generative Upscale in the desktop version marks a pivotal shift. Harmonize intelligently matches colors and lighting across different image elements, ensuring cohesive results in composite work. Generative Upscale, on the other hand, enhances image resolution while preserving details, which is crucial for print professionals dealing with low-res assets. These tools, as highlighted in Adobe’s official release notes on their help site, are designed to save hours in post-production.

Elevating Precision with Conversational Editing

The integration of conversational editing represents another leap forward, allowing users to describe changes in natural language for AI to execute. This feature, rolled out in late 2025, enables phrases like “make the sky more dramatic” to trigger adjustments in exposure, contrast, and color grading. Industry insiders note that this reduces the learning curve for complex edits, making Photoshop more accessible to multidisciplinary teams. A recent analysis from ZDNET emphasizes how this tool democratizes high-level editing for non-experts.

Complementing these is the enhanced Neural Filters suite, which now includes advanced options like Style Transfer and Portrait Enhancer. Style Transfer applies artistic styles from reference images, ideal for concept artists iterating on visual themes. The Portrait Enhancer uses AI to refine facial features, smoothing skin and adjusting lighting with minimal manual input. As per a step-by-step tutorial in Creative Studios Derby, these filters are particularly valuable in fashion and advertising, where quick turnarounds are essential.

Moreover, Photoshop’s collaboration with third-party AI models expands creative possibilities. Users can now switch to models like Flux or Nano Banana for Generative Fill, each excelling in specific scenarios—Flux for realistic textures and Nano Banana for stylized outputs. This flexibility, detailed in an article from Digital Camera World, allows professionals to tailor AI assistance to project needs, from photorealistic renders to abstract designs.

Integration with Broader Ecosystems and Workflows

A groundbreaking development is Photoshop’s embedding within ChatGPT, announced in December 2025. This integration lets users edit images conversationally without leaving the chat interface, handling tasks like background removal or PDF modifications. No subscription is required for basic features, broadening access. CNET reports that this addresses common frustrations in AI editing, such as iterative refinements, by enabling real-time feedback loops.

This ChatGPT tie-in extends to Adobe Express and Acrobat, facilitating seamless workflows across apps. For example, a designer can generate an image in Photoshop via ChatGPT, then incorporate it into a PDF presentation. TechCrunch covered this rollout in depth, noting in their piece on TechCrunch how it empowers users to animate elements or modify documents through prompts, streamlining content creation for marketers and educators.

On the performance side, updates in Photoshop 2025 include AI-driven optimization for hardware acceleration, ensuring smoother operation on diverse devices. This is especially beneficial for remote teams using cloud-based workflows. The Photoshop Training Channel outlines how these enhancements reduce lag in large-scale projects, a boon for film and game industry professionals handling high-resolution assets.

Practical Tutorials and Real-World Applications

To harness these tools effectively, insiders recommend starting with tutorials that break down each feature. For Generative Fill, select an area, input a prompt, and let AI generate variations—refine with masks for precision. A comprehensive walkthrough from Aela.io demonstrates how this accelerates ideation in product design, where rapid mockups are key.

For conversational editing, integrate it into daily routines by combining it with layer management. Professionals in e-commerce photography use it to batch-process product images, adjusting lighting uniformly across sets. Lifehacker’s hands-on test, as shared in their article on Lifehacker, reveals that while initial results impress, iterative prompting yields professional-grade outcomes.

Industry sentiment, gleaned from posts on X, reflects excitement mixed with cautious optimism. Users praise the time savings but debate AI’s role in creativity, with some viewing it as a replacement for traditional skills. One viral thread highlighted how these tools could “flip the design industry,” echoing broader discussions on AI’s disruptive potential without confirming wholesale job displacement.

Ethical Considerations and Future Trajectories

As AI permeates Photoshop, ethical questions arise, particularly around authenticity and bias in generated content. Insiders must navigate copyright implications when using AI-trained on vast datasets. Adobe addresses this by emphasizing ethical AI development in Firefly, trained on licensed images. Google’s AI updates blog, in a post on Google’s blog, parallels this by discussing breakthroughs in responsible AI, offering a comparative view for Photoshop users.

Looking ahead, integrations like third-party models suggest a trend toward modular AI ecosystems. This could lead to specialized plugins for niches like medical imaging or architectural visualization. The Reddit community, in discussions on Reddit, debates opting for pre-AI versions, underscoring a divide between purists and adopters.

For insiders, mastering these tools involves balancing AI assistance with human ingenuity. Workshops and certifications are emerging to train on ethical usage, ensuring AI enhances rather than supplants creativity. As one X post noted, these features save “hundreds of hours,” allowing focus on conceptual work.

Case Studies from Industry Leaders

Real-world applications illuminate AI’s impact. In advertising, agencies use Generative Upscale to repurpose archival photos for high-definition campaigns, maintaining quality without original files. A case from the fashion sector, as per industry reports, shows Portrait Enhancer cutting retouching time by 70%, enabling faster seasonal lookbooks.

Film post-production benefits from Harmonize, syncing visual effects across frames seamlessly. VFX artists report improved efficiency in compositing CGI with live footage. Drawing from Google’s research breakthroughs detailed on their blog, similar AI advancements in image editing hint at cross-pollination between tech giants, potentially influencing future Photoshop updates.

Educators and trainers are incorporating these tools into curricula, teaching students to leverage AI for innovation. Online platforms offer courses that simulate professional scenarios, preparing the next generation for an AI-augmented field.

Navigating Challenges and Best Practices

Despite advantages, challenges persist, such as AI hallucinations where generated elements don’t align perfectly. Best practices include verifying outputs with manual tweaks and using reference images for guidance. Insiders recommend versioning files to track AI interventions, maintaining transparency in collaborative projects.

Hardware considerations are key; while cloud processing handles heavy lifts, local setups benefit from GPUs for real-time edits. Adobe’s updates optimize for this, but users should monitor system requirements.

Community feedback on X underscores the need for ongoing tutorials, with users sharing tips on optimizing prompts for better results. This collective knowledge base enriches the ecosystem, fostering innovation.

Strategic Implications for Professionals

For industry leaders, adopting these AI features strategically positions firms ahead of competitors. Integrating them into pipelines can reduce costs and accelerate deliverables, crucial in fast-paced sectors like social media content creation.

Looking to 2026, rumors suggest deeper AI personalization, perhaps predictive editing based on user history. This could revolutionize bespoke design services.

Ultimately, Photoshop’s AI evolution empowers creators to focus on vision over mechanics, heralding a new era of digital artistry where technology amplifies human potential. As tools mature, the line between creator and creation blurs, inviting endless possibilities.

name: Kraft Heinz
title: Princes Group to operate Plasmon baby food business under lease deal - AJ Bell
description:
This includes the number one baby food brand in Italy, Plasmon, as well as other brands including Nipiol, BiAglut, Aproten and Dieterba.
Princes said subsidiary Princes Italia Spa has entered an operating asset lease agreement with Plasmon, which will take effect on Thursday.
Under the terms of the lease, all operations related to the Plasmon business will be carried out by Princes Italia.
Princes said the parties have reserved the right to assess, at a later stage, the potential transfer of the Plasmon business directly to Princes.
Chair Angelo Mastrolia said: ‘The integration of the Plasmon business represents a strategically important step for Princes Group.
text:
Princes Group PLC on Wednesday said its parent company NewPrinces Spa has completed the acquisition of Plasmon Srl from Kraft Heinz Co for €124.3 million in cash.

The Liverpool, England-based food and beverage firm said Plasmon is a newly established company which owns the business related to the manufacturing, packaging, marketing, selling and distribution of baby food and specialty nutrition food products.

This includes the number one baby food brand in Italy, Plasmon, as well as other brands including Nipiol, BiAglut, Aproten and Dieterba.

Princes said subsidiary Princes Italia Spa has entered an operating asset lease agreement with Plasmon, which will take effect on Thursday.

Under the terms of the lease, all operations related to the Plasmon business will be carried out by Princes Italia.

Princes said the parties have reserved the right to assess, at a later stage, the potential transfer of the Plasmon business directly to Princes.

Under the lease, Princes Italia is required to make yearly rent payments of €3 million, as well as 1.5% of revenue derived from the operation of the business.

The lease has an initial duration of three years and can be renewed at Princes Italia’s sole discretion by giving six months notice to Plasmon.

‘The board considers it in shareholders’ best interests to preserve capital in order to access further value-accretive M&A and strategic growth opportunities, while benefiting from predictable cash outflows, reduced asset risk and significant flexibility to extend or exit the arrangement,’ Princes said.

Chair Angelo Mastrolia said: ‘The integration of the Plasmon business represents a strategically important step for Princes Group. It reinforces our leadership in baby food and specialised nutrition, builds on long-standing industrial expertise and reunites highly complementary assets within the group.

‘We believe this transaction strengthens our European industrial platform and supports the continued development of our core categories over the long term.’

Shares in Princes were marginally higher at 455.51 pence on Wednesday morning in London.

title: NewPrinces finalises acquisition of Plasmon from Kraft Heinz - Il Sole 24 ORE
description:
Following the announcement released on 9 July 2025, NewPrinces and The Kraft Heinz Company announce the completion of the acquisition by NewPrinces of 100 per cent of the share capital of the newly formed company Plasmon from KHC's Italian subsidiary, Heinz Italia S.p.A.
In Italy, Heinz continued to record steady growth in both the Retail and Away from Home channels, significantly increasing its market share in the Taste Elevation category.
Angelo Mastrolia, President of NewPrinces, commented: 'The finalisation of this transaction represents the fulfilment of a long-term strategic vision.
Carmela Bazzarelli, Managing Director of Kraft Heinz Italy, commented: "We believe that the business is well positioned to continue its development path under the leadership of the NewPrinces Group, a leader in the food & beverage sector and the ideal partner for the growth of these historic brands.
Kraft Heinz reaffirms its commitment in Italy, where it will continue to focus on the growth of the Taste Elevation platform with the Kraft and Heinz brands, supported by new investments and an increased strategic focus made possible by this transaction".
text:
Following the announcement released on 9 July 2025, NewPrinces and The Kraft Heinz Company announce the completion of the acquisition by NewPrinces of 100 per cent of the share capital of the newly formed company Plasmon from KHC's Italian subsidiary, Heinz Italia S.p.A. Thus a note from the companies.

The target,' the note continues, 'controls the activities related to the production, packaging, marketing, sale and distribution of baby food and specialised nutrition products, including the Plasmon, Nipiol, BiAglut, Aproten and Dieterba brands, as well as the production plant in Latina.

The final purchase price of the Transaction was EUR 124.3 million, paid entirely in cash. The target's business recorded sales of approximately EUR 170 million and an Ebitda of EUR 17 million as at 31 December 2024. The deal is part of Kraft Heinz's strategy to drive profitable growth through its Accelerate platforms, which include Heinz Tomato Ketchup and other 'Taste Elevation' products such as mayonnaise, table sauces, culinary products and ready-made sauces. In Italy, Heinz continued to record steady growth in both the Retail and Away from Home channels, significantly increasing its market share in the Taste Elevation category.

Angelo Mastrolia, President of NewPrinces, commented: 'The finalisation of this transaction represents the fulfilment of a long-term strategic vision. Bringing back to Italy brands such as Plasmon, Nipiol, BiAglut, Aproten and Dieterba, which are deeply rooted in the identity of our country, together with a highly efficient production plant such as the one in Latina, strengthens our position as a reference platform in the high-margin segment of baby food and specialised nutrition in Italy and Europe. We now look to the integration of Plasmon and the exploitation of the significant industrial and commercial synergies with the capabilities already present in the Group, in order to generate value for all our stakeholders".

Carmela Bazzarelli, Managing Director of Kraft Heinz Italy, commented: "We believe that the business is well positioned to continue its development path under the leadership of the NewPrinces Group, a leader in the food & beverage sector and the ideal partner for the growth of these historic brands. Kraft Heinz reaffirms its commitment in Italy, where it will continue to focus on the growth of the Taste Elevation platform with the Kraft and Heinz brands, supported by new investments and an increased strategic focus made possible by this transaction".

name: Eli Lilly
title: Today is Warren Buffett's last day as Berkshire CEO. Business leaders tell us what they ...
description:
(CNN) — Warren Buffett has worn many hats over the years: The stock-picking Oracle of Omaha.
But for generations of business leaders, the 95-year-old has also served as something else: a teacher.
As the iconic investor steps down from his post, several business leaders told CNN about the lessons Buffett leaves behind.
“From Warren Buffett, I’ve learned that excellence really is a discipline,” said Larry Restieri, CEO at wealth management firm Hightower.
“When you help someone in any of thousands of ways, you help the world,” Buffett wrote in 2025.
text:
(CNN) — Warren Buffett has worn many hats over the years: The stock-picking Oracle of Omaha. An avuncular, Dairy-Queen-eating, Coke-drinking product pitchman. A living symbol of capitalism and its complexities.

But for generations of business leaders, the 95-year-old has also served as something else: a teacher.

Buffett’s combination of success and sagacity has made him one of the most famous investors in the world, “on the Mount Rushmore of business leaders in our country,” Eli Lilly CEO David Ricks said. And through his advice-packed investor letters, his hourslong quote-fest annual meetings, his choices at work or in his personal life, Buffett has taught CEOs and executives around the world how to run their businesses and, in many cases, their lives.

Buffett, who’s spent much of his life among the top 10 richest people in the world, is stepping down Wednesday as head of conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway; protégé Greg Abel will take the reins Thursday.

As the iconic investor steps down from his post, several business leaders told CNN about the lessons Buffett leaves behind.

‘Predicting rain doesn’t count’

As a journalist, I’ve covered countless earnings reports. None were as fun as Berkshire Hathaway’s, in large part because Buffett remains among the business world’s top communicators.

He said what he meant, and he never used a 10-cent word if a one-cent word would do. And he was flat-out funny in a way that made covering him a hoot.

“What I’ve always admired about Warren Buffett, and (his late business partner) Charlie Munger for that matter, is their use of plain English and plain language to explain difficult concepts,” Steve Hafner, the CEO of Kayak, said. “It takes a lot of skill to take a complex issue and just split it to the bare minimum.”

Their dry wit made “their shareholder letter one of my favorite reads,” he added.

Some gems among those shareholder letters:

“It’s only when the tide goes out that you learn who’s been swimming naked.”“Predicting rain doesn’t count; building arks does.”“I’ve reluctantly discarded the notion of my continuing to manage the portfolio after my death – abandoning my hope to give new meaning to the term ‘thinking outside the box.’”

‘Our favorite holding period is forever’

One theme among the CEOs who spoke to CNN: Buffett’s legendary patience. Buffett was known to sit on ginormous piles of cash at Berkshire, waiting for the right opportunity to invest. And when he did invest, he was in it for the long haul: “our favorite holding period is forever,” he wrote to shareholders in 1989.

Investor, podcaster, entrepreneur and former White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci wrote to Buffett 30 years ago, saying he was buying Berkshire shares for his daughter.

“And since she was one and a half years old with a life expectancy of 84 years, she had 82 and a half years left in which to hold her stock,” Scaramucci said.

“He wrote back very quickly and said that was a manifestation of short-termism. His own intention was to hold the stock for a hundred years.”

‘I will be ruthless’

Yes, Buffett was a shark who made billions of dollars off Goldman Sachs, among the most hardcore capitalists on the planet.

But he was a shark with ethics.

“From Warren Buffett, I’ve learned that excellence really is a discipline,” said Larry Restieri, CEO at wealth management firm Hightower. “Set a clear direction, stay true to your principles and execute patiently.”

Buffett racked up a net worth around $150 billion, according to Bloomberg, but he always emphasized honesty and integrity.

And he expected the same from every single person who worked with him: “Lose money for the firm and I will be understanding. Lose a shred of reputation for the firm, and I will be ruthless,” he once testified before Congress.

‘A vast collection of possessions ends up possessing its owner’

Buffett famously loves flying private. He is a Cadillac fan. He is uber-wealthy, and he makes no apologies for it.

But he has also decided to pass on some of his massive riches. Buffett, along with Bill Gates and Melinda French Gates, created the Giving Pledge in 2010 for the world’s richest people to promise “to give the majority of their wealth to charitable causes in their lifetime or wills.”

Marcel Arsenault, the CEO of Real Capital Solutions, is one of the people who signed that pledge. “Warren inspired me to think beyond monetary success,” he told CNN.

In a letter explaining his commitment, Buffett wrote: “Too often, a vast collection of possessions ends up possessing its owner.”

But giving doesn’t have to be about piles of cash.

“When you help someone in any of thousands of ways, you help the world,” Buffett wrote in 2025. “Kindness is costless but also priceless.”

The-CNN-Wire™ & © 2025 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

2. The Business Model: Cash Machine, Not Trend Machine

Key angles for you:

3. The “Is It Worth the Hype?” Test

Low volatility vs. meme spikes

PT H.M. Sampoerna Tbk vs. The Competition

Global Rivals: Philip Morris International, British American Tobacco, Altria

Big global names like Philip Morris International (PM), British American Tobacco (BTI), and Altria (MO) dominate US investor attention. They trade in New York, they show up on US broker apps instantly, and they get way more social chatter.

Who Wins the Clout War?

If we're talking pure viral potential, the winner is the global names. More people search them, more TikToks mention them, and more YouTube creators review their dividends and “sin stock” strategies.

But if the question is: where can a patient investor potentially find under-the-radar value? Sampoerna has a shot. While everyone fights over the same US tickers, this one sits in the “know if you know” zone.

So in a clout contest, Sampoerna loses. In a “quiet, cash-focused, emerging market tobacco” niche? It absolutely holds its own.

The Business Side: Sampoerna

Here's where it gets serious. PT H.M. Sampoerna Tbk is tied to the ISIN ID1000070105, listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. That ISIN is your unique ID tag for this exact stock. No confusion, no ticker mix-ups.

Structure: Connected to a global player (Philip Morris International) but operating as a local champion.

On the price-performance side, recent trading action has been more about small percentage moves around the last close than huge breakouts. That fits the profile: this is a defensive, income-tilted stock, not a moonshot.

Also, remember: if you're in the US, you're dealing with:

Access issues: You may need a broker that supports foreign markets or depository receipts, depending on how you want exposure.

Regulation and ethics: Tobacco is always under fire. Some funds avoid it completely; others lean in for yield.

The move here is not “ape in.” It's research, compare, size carefully.

Final Verdict: Cop or Drop?

If you want a viral stock you can brag about on TikTok, this is a drop. There's no flashy tech, no meme army, no overnight x10 fantasy.

Exposure to a major emerging market

A classic dividend and cash flow style play

A “boring but potentially steady” name tied to a global tobacco giant

Understand the ethical and regulatory baggage around tobacco

Accept currency and emerging market risk

Are cool with “slow and steady” instead of trying to go viral with your portfolio

Is it a game-changer? Not in the culture sense. Is it potentially a smart, under-hyped income piece in a global portfolio? That's where it quietly wins.

Real talk: this is not for everyone. But if you're building a serious, mixed-asset portfolio and not just chasing the next meme, PT H.M. Sampoerna Tbk deserves at least a spot on your watchlist.

text:
S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI) is included among the 14 Best Dividend Aristocrats to Invest in Heading into 2026.

On December 10, S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI) announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Google Cloud. The goal is to speed up an enterprise-wide transformation tied to agentic innovation, data distribution, and workflow automation.

The move marks another step in S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI)’s broader AI and cloud strategy. The partnership draws on Google Cloud’s data and AI capabilities to strengthen how S&P Global builds and delivers intelligence products for customers around the world. The focus is on advancing data and agentic AI for customers and empowering S&P Global’s workforce with agentic capabilities.

As part of the effort, S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI) will continue rolling out tools designed to lift productivity and efficiency. That includes Gemini Enterprise, Google Cloud’s agentic platform, along with other AI tools. The company is also developing data agents that embed S&P Global’s datasets directly into client workflows.

A few days later, on December 16, Goldman Sachs raised its price target on S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI) to $640 from $637 and reiterated a Buy rating. The firm pointed to structural and cyclical tailwinds that are supporting “healthy” debt issuance volumes and steady growth in ratings revenue over the near to medium term.

S&P Global Inc. (NYSE:SPGI) enables businesses, governments, and individuals to use trusted data, expertise, and technology to make decisions with conviction.

While we acknowledge the potential of SPGI as an investment, we believe certain AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk. If you’re looking for an extremely undervalued AI stock that also stands to benefit significantly from Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend, see our free report on the best short-term AI stock.

name: HP Inc
outlet: HP Inc. Is Quietly Going Off: Is This Boring Tech Stock Your Next Power Play?
title: HP Inc. Is Quietly Going Off: Is This Boring Tech Stock Your Next Power Play?
description:
The Hype is Real: HP Inc. on TikTok and Beyond HP isn’t the flashiest brand on your For You Page, but it’s absolutely in the mix.
When you look at HP Inc. right now, three things really matter: price, AI, and cash flow.
The Stock Price Move: Sneaky Strong On the market side, HP Inc. trades under the ticker HPQ in the US.
We’re talking a steady dividend yield that’s actually noticeable, plus aggressive stock buybacks that shrink the share count over time.
As a product brand: HP is a solid cop if you care more about value and performance than flexing.
text:
The internet is losing it over HP Inc. – but is it actually worth your money?

You know HP Inc. as the printer and laptop brand that’s been in your life since school. But right now, its stock is doing the "wait, how is this up again?" move that has Wall Street and TikTok quietly paying attention.

While everyone is chasing the loud AI names, HP Inc. (ticker: HPQ) is running a different play: steady profits, massive buybacks, chunky dividends, and a sneaky AI PC angle that could flip the script on what "boring" looks like in your portfolio.

So let’s talk real talk: is HP Inc. a must-have money play right now, or a value trap dressed up as a comeback story?

The Hype is Real: HP Inc. on TikTok and Beyond

HP isn’t the flashiest brand on your For You Page, but it’s absolutely in the mix. From budget creators shopping for study laptops to small businesses rage-posting about printer ink prices, HP content is everywhere – and it’s surprisingly positive.

Creators are calling out HP for one thing: solid performance for the price. Not the sexiest flex, but when you’re buying gear to actually get stuff done, that hits.

Want to see the receipts? Check the latest reviews here:

Watch viral TikTok reviews of HP Inc.

Watch honest tests on YouTube

From unboxings of budget HP laptops to side-by-side tests against way pricier machines, the vibe is the same: "Did I just pay way less and still get a legit setup?"

Top or Flop? What You Need to Know

Let’s strip this down. When you look at HP Inc. right now, three things really matter: price, AI, and cash flow.

1. The Stock Price Move: Sneaky Strong

On the market side, HP Inc. trades under the ticker HPQ in the US. Based on live data pulled from major financial platforms, HPQ is sitting around the mid-$30s per share, with the latest quoted price and performance coming from real-time sources like Yahoo Finance and MarketWatch. As of the most recent market session, the numbers show the stock holding comfortably in that range, with the last close slightly below the live quote when markets were active. Exact intraday ticks change constantly, but here’s the real talk: HP has been drifting higher over recent months instead of collapsing like a dying hardware dinosaur.

That matters. In a market where hype names spike and crash, HP is acting like a slow-burn compounder: not viral, but not dead money either.

2. AI PCs: The "Wait, HP Does That Too?" Angle

HP isn’t trying to be the next pure AI software god. Instead, it’s doing something more practical: AI-powered PCs and creator-focused laptops. Think machines optimized for on-device AI tasks, better battery, smoother video calls, faster content workflows.

Is it a game-changer? For you as a buyer, it can be. HP’s AI-focused laptops and workstations are positioned as "do more with less" tools: fewer lags, more multitasking, video, editing, streaming, and school or work in the same box without meltdown.

If HP sticks the landing here, it turns into the quiet backbone of the AI hardware world – not the brand trending every day, but the gear behind a ton of content, work, and small-business setups.

3. Cash Machine Mode: Dividends and Buybacks

This is the part that doesn’t go viral on TikTok but absolutely matters for your portfolio. HP Inc. throws off serious cash flow and sends a lot of it back to shareholders. We’re talking a steady dividend yield that’s actually noticeable, plus aggressive stock buybacks that shrink the share count over time.

Translation: HP is literally using its own cash to boost the value of each share you own. If you’re into long-term stacking instead of day-trading chaos, this is not a flop move. It’s the "quietly getting rich" strategy.

HP Inc. vs. The Competition

In your actual shopping cart and in the stock market, HP’s biggest rival is Dell, with Lenovo and Apple lurking in the mix.

HP vs Dell: Who Wins the Clout War?

For clout: Apple wins, obviously. MacBooks will always get more aesthetic desk shots and influencer love.

For "bang for your buck" PCs: That’s where HP and Dell go head-to-head.

HP: Strong in consumer laptops, Chromebooks, student devices, and SMB printers. Feels more "everyday user" and content-creator friendly at midrange prices.

Dell: Big in corporate fleets and work setups. XPS line has serious respect with power users, but prices can climb fast.

On the stock side, both HP and Dell lean into buybacks and dividends. The difference is perception: Dell gets more "serious enterprise" respect, while HP feels like the accessible brand you’ve actually owned.

So who wins? If you want pure clout, you go Apple. If you want a realistic, affordable setup that gets the job done without nuking your budget, HP is absolutely in the "worth the hype" lane right now – especially for students, creators, and side-hustlers.

Final Verdict: Cop or Drop?

Let’s answer it straight: Is HP Inc. a cop or a drop?

As a product brand: HP is a solid cop if you care more about value and performance than flexing. The laptops and printers may not trend every week, but real users keep buying them because they work and they’re priced to move. For a lot of people, that’s a game-changer.

As a stock (HPQ): HP is a quiet cop for long-term thinkers, not short-term moon-chasers. You’re not getting the explosive AI meme-stock story, but you are getting:

A stock that hasn’t totally blown up in price yet.

Cash coming back to you through dividends and buybacks.

Exposure to the AI PC wave without paying AI-bubble prices.

If your vibe is "set it, watch it, and let compounding do its thing," HP looks more like a no-brainer value play than a flop. If you only want hyper-viral, triple-digit growth stories, you’ll probably find HP too chill for your taste.

Real talk: HP Inc. sits in that underrated zone where the social media chatter is modest, the numbers are grown-up, and the upside comes from patience, not panic-buying.

The Business Side: HP Inc. Aktie

For anyone watching the company as a global stock play, HP Inc. is also traded as an "Aktie" on international markets, tied to the ISIN US40434L1052. That code is basically the universal ID for HP Inc. shares across borders.

Here’s what matters from a market-watch angle:

Stability over drama: HP’s financials lean into predictable hardware demand, recurring printer supplies, and services. Less meme, more math.

AI as an upgrade cycle: As AI PCs and next-gen laptops roll out, HP gets a shot at a major refresh cycle. Every time people replace old devices with AI-optimized ones, HP has a chance to grab more share.

Shareholder returns: Dividends and buybacks mean that even if growth is mid, total return can still be strong.

The catch? This is not a zero-to-hero story. HP’s upside is tied to execution: staying relevant in laptops, keeping printers profitable, and not getting steamrolled by Apple, Dell, or the next wave of AI hardware challengers.

If you want exposure to the everyday tech that actually powers offices, schools, and home setups – not just the buzziest headlines – HP Inc. Aktie (ISIN US40434L1052) is absolutely worth a look.

Bottom line: HP Inc. might never dominate your feed, but it might quietly boost your net worth. And in a market full of hype, that low-key might be the real game-changer.

Based on RBC’s assessment, here are the top U.S. bank stocks to watch: Bank of America is highlighted by RBC as well positioned to capitalize on the favorable banking environment projected for 2026.
First Horizon Corporation is cited by RBC as a bank positioned to perform well in a robust 2026 environment.
Separately, PNC Bank announced it would reduce its prime lending rate to 6.75%.
RBC also highlighted , , , , and as additional bank stocks it favors within its constructive outlook for the sector.
text:
Investing.com -- The U.S. banking sector is positioned for continued strength in 2026, according to a recent analysis by RBC Capital Markets.

With economic growth projected between 2.0-2.5%, a steepening yield curve, accelerating loan growth, and easing regulatory burdens, bank stocks appear poised for outperformance.

RBC Capital Markets highlights several key drivers for the sector’s robust outlook, including increased Commercial & Industrial lending, Commercial Real Estate financing, and home equity lending. Elevated M&A activity is also expected to benefit the industry.

However, the analysis warns that re-emerging inflation could prompt the Federal Reserve to shift monetary policy, potentially leading to higher interest rates that could impact the sector.

Based on RBC’s assessment, here are the top U.S. bank stocks to watch:

Bank of America is highlighted by RBC as well positioned to capitalize on the favorable banking environment projected for 2026.

Bank of America, along with Goldman Sachs, is leading a group of investors in the Texas Stock Exchange. The bank was also part of a group that shelved a planned $20 billion bailout for Argentina in favor of a smaller, short-term loan package.

Popular

is also among RBC’s preferred banks, demonstrating strong fundamentals that align with the positive sector outlook.

Popular Inc. recently reported third-quarter 2025 earnings that surpassed EPS expectations, though revenue slightly missed forecasts. The company also declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.75 per share on its common stock.

Citigroup is included in RBC’s list of banks expected to benefit from accelerating loan growth and a steepening yield curve.

Citigroup received an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight from Neutral, and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency terminated an amendment to a 2020 consent order. In addition, Citibank announced it would reduce its base lending rate to 6.75%.

First Horizon Corporation is cited by RBC as a bank positioned to perform well in a robust 2026 environment.

First Horizon Corporation’s board authorized a new $1.2 billion common stock repurchase program and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.15 per share.

The company also received an initiation of coverage with a Buy rating from Deutsche Bank, while Baird downgraded the stock to Neutral.

Fifth Third Bancorp is viewed positively by RBC as regulatory burdens ease and commercial lending accelerates.

Fifth Third Bancorp recently reported third-quarter 2025 results that beat both earnings and revenue forecasts. The company also announced upcoming board changes and received a price target increase from TD Cowen.

Huntington Bancshares Incorporated is among the banks RBC expects to benefit from projected economic growth.

Huntington Bancshares received a price target increase from RBC Capital and announced it would lower its prime rate to 6.75 percent. The bank also appointed Marc Dizard as chief investment officer for its Wealth Management division.

KeyCorp is highlighted by RBC as an institution positioned to capitalize on favorable banking conditions.

KeyCorp announced a reduction in its prime lending rate to 6.75 percent and received a price target increase from DA Davidson. The company also disclosed it will redeem all of its outstanding 4.700% Fixed Rate Senior Bank Notes due January 2026.

M&T Bank Corporation is included among RBC’s favored banks, positioned for potential outperformance.

M&T Bank Corporation reported third-quarter 2025 earnings that surpassed analyst expectations for earnings per share. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $1.50 per share on its common stock and reduced its prime lending rate.

The PNC Financial Services Group is viewed by RBC as having strong potential in the positive banking environment forecast for 2026.

The PNC Financial Services Group has received all required regulatory approvals to complete its acquisition of FirstBank Holding Company. Separately, PNC Bank announced it would reduce its prime lending rate to 6.75%.

Truist Financial Corporation is also included in RBC’s group of top U.S. banks, expected to benefit from loan growth and M&A activity.

Truist Financial Corporation announced its board has authorized a new $10 billion share repurchase program. The company also launched a new digital wealth management platform and received a rating downgrade to Neutral from Baird.

RBC also highlighted , , , , and as additional bank stocks it favors within its constructive outlook for the sector.

The analysis emphasizes that continued economic growth and the steepening yield curve should create favorable conditions for these institutions, though investors should remain watchful for inflation signals that could alter the Federal Reserve’s current monetary policy trajectory.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

● For the past year, analysts covering the stock have been revising their EPS expectations upwards in a significant manner.
This results from either a good visibility into core activities or accurate earnings releases.
● The group usually releases upbeat results with huge surprise rates.
text:
● The group's activity appears highly profitable thanks to its outperforming net margins.

● Its low valuation, with P/E ratio at 10.31 and 9.7 for the ongoing fiscal year and 2026 respectively, makes the stock pretty attractive with regard to earnings multiples.

● The company is one of the best yield companies with high dividend expectations.

● Over the last twelve months, the sales forecast has been frequently revised upwards.

● For the past year, analysts covering the stock have been revising their EPS expectations upwards in a significant manner.

● Predictions on business development from analysts polled by Standard & Poor's are tight. This results from either a good visibility into core activities or accurate earnings releases.

● The group usually releases upbeat results with huge surprise rates.

name: Wellington Management
title: Pool Corporation (NASDAQ:POOL) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Analysts
description:
Pool Corporation (NASDAQ:POOL - Get Free Report) has received an average recommendation of "Hold" from the twelve brokerages that are presently covering the stock, Marketbeat Ratings reports.
Get Our Latest Stock Report on Pool Hedge Funds Weigh In On Pool Should Investors Lock Arms With Buffett and Dive Into POOL Stock?
Buffett's Latest Portfolio Moves, and Another Secret Stock Pool (NASDAQ:POOL - Get Free Report) last released its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, October 23rd.
About Pool (Get Free Report) Pool Corporation is a leading wholesale distributor of swimming pool supplies, equipment, and related outdoor living products.
While Pool currently has a Hold rating among analysts, top-rated analysts believe these five stocks are better buys.
text:
Pool Corporation (NASDAQ:POOL - Get Free Report) has received an average recommendation of "Hold" from the twelve brokerages that are presently covering the stock, Marketbeat Ratings reports. One research analyst has rated the stock with a sell recommendation, seven have given a hold recommendation and four have assigned a buy recommendation to the company. The average twelve-month price target among brokers that have covered the stock in the last year is $317.3750.

Buffett Makes Big Moves Outside of UNH: A Buy and Sell Breakdown

Several analysts have recently issued reports on the company. Weiss Ratings reiterated a "sell (d+)" rating on shares of Pool in a research note on Monday. KeyCorp started coverage on Pool in a report on Tuesday, September 30th. They issued a "sector weight" rating for the company. The Goldman Sachs Group set a $360.00 price target on Pool and gave the company a "buy" rating in a report on Thursday, October 23rd. William Blair restated a "market perform" rating on shares of Pool in a research note on Wednesday, October 15th. Finally, Wells Fargo & Company decreased their price objective on shares of Pool from $320.00 to $250.00 and set an "equal weight" rating for the company in a report on Monday, December 15th.

Get Our Latest Stock Report on Pool

Hedge Funds Weigh In On Pool

Should Investors Lock Arms With Buffett and Dive Into POOL Stock?

Large investors have recently made changes to their positions in the business. Berkshire Hathaway Inc grew its holdings in Pool by 136.3% in the 2nd quarter. Berkshire Hathaway Inc now owns 3,458,885 shares of the specialty retailer's stock valued at $1,008,196,000 after buying an additional 1,994,885 shares during the last quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP grew its stake in shares of Pool by 16.2% in the third quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 2,563,373 shares of the specialty retailer's stock worth $794,825,000 after acquiring an additional 357,643 shares during the last quarter. Invesco Ltd. increased its position in Pool by 11.1% during the second quarter. Invesco Ltd. now owns 699,628 shares of the specialty retailer's stock worth $203,928,000 after acquiring an additional 70,075 shares during the period. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA raised its stake in Pool by 35.3% during the 2nd quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 616,041 shares of the specialty retailer's stock valued at $179,564,000 after purchasing an additional 160,878 shares during the last quarter. Finally, William Blair Investment Management LLC boosted its holdings in Pool by 13.9% in the 2nd quarter. William Blair Investment Management LLC now owns 586,310 shares of the specialty retailer's stock valued at $170,898,000 after purchasing an additional 71,373 shares during the period. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 98.99% of the company's stock.

Pool Stock Performance

Shares of POOL opened at $231.07 on Wednesday. The company's fifty day moving average is $248.27 and its 200-day moving average is $287.12. Pool has a 12 month low of $227.40 and a 12 month high of $374.74. The firm has a market cap of $8.61 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 21.06, a price-to-earnings-growth ratio of 4.30 and a beta of 1.23. The company has a quick ratio of 0.87, a current ratio of 2.57 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.76.

Buffett's Latest Portfolio Moves, and Another Secret Stock

Pool (NASDAQ:POOL - Get Free Report) last released its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, October 23rd. The specialty retailer reported $3.39 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $3.38 by $0.01. The business had revenue of $1.45 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.46 billion. Pool had a net margin of 7.77% and a return on equity of 31.40%. Pool's quarterly revenue was up 1.3% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business earned $3.26 EPS. Pool has set its FY 2025 guidance at 10.700-11.200 EPS. Equities analysts expect that Pool will post 11.32 EPS for the current fiscal year.

Pool Dividend Announcement

The company also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which was paid on Wednesday, November 26th. Shareholders of record on Wednesday, November 12th were issued a dividend of $1.25 per share. This represents a $5.00 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 2.2%. The ex-dividend date was Wednesday, November 12th. Pool's dividend payout ratio is 45.58%.

About Pool

(Get Free Report)

Pool Corporation is a leading wholesale distributor of swimming pool supplies, equipment, and related outdoor living products. Headquartered in Covington, Louisiana, the company serves a diverse customer base that includes service professionals, independent retailers, high-volume builders, and national retail chains. Pool Corporation's extensive branch network enables it to maintain strong local customer relationships while leveraging its scale to source products efficiently from manufacturers around the world.

The company's product portfolio spans pool and spa chemicals, water treatment equipment, pumps, filters, heaters, automation and control systems, liners, safety covers, and cleaning accessories.

Featured Stories

Five stocks we like better than Pool

ALERT: Drop these 5 stocks before January 2026!
